summary:
A seasoned IT Leader and innovator with significant international experience, a rich entrepreneurial background and a proven track record of success in both the public and private sectors.  Experienced in corporate strategy development, innovation management, system architecture, system engineering, IT operations, IT staffing, organizational change management, and marketing.

Currently serving as the founder and first Executive Director of The Defense Innovation Greenhouse (The DIG), an innovation, collaboration and best practices center aimed at accelerating the uptake of the latest technologies into EU / NATO military establishments and crisis responder communities.  Building on my experience in both large inter-governmental organizations and also in small companies, I have a unique perspective of the challenges faced in the public sector to keep pace with the extremely rapid changes happening in IT and also in society as a whole.  The DIG will provide a bridge allowing easy access between these vastly different communities.

Experience in the following roles: 
  ★ Founder / Executive Director of a multi-national innovation and collaboration center
  ★ CTO of an innovative, high-growth transaction processing company
  ★ Change manager on a transition team for a large public sector IT Agency
  ★ Project / program manager for numerous multi-million Euro IT capability delivery efforts
  ★ Founder of three non-profit organizations
  ★ Senior customer-facing liaison on-site in Afghanistan for four months in 2007
  ★ Solution Architect on major projects in both the public and private sector

Technical experience includes software development, data modeling, data center operation, IKM, SOA, BPMS, Dynamic Case Management systems, cloud-based application development.

Outside interests include running, biking, photography, and amateur theatre. 

Inquiries accepted.

education.degree_name: Diploma of Advanced Studies (DAS) in Renewable Energy Management (REM)
education.grade: Currently enrolled, anticipated graduation date: April 2016

awards.title: NATO Medal for ISAF (Afghanistan)
awards.description:
Personnel eligible for the award of the ISAF medal are those who are members of units or staffs taking part in, or supporting NATO operations in Afghanistan. Entitlement will be acquired by those forces under NATO command or control whilst in the Joint Operational Area (JOA), and those deployed to the JOA under national command in support of the NATO operation.

The JOA includes Afghanistan and all neighbouring countries that have borders contiguous with Afghanistan where forces could assemble and from which ISAF may be supported. 

The qualifying period in the Afghanistan JOA is 30 days continuous service or 60 days accumulated service within a two year period, from 1 June 2003 and a termination date, which will be notified in a supplementary document.

awards.title: Navy Achievement Medal - Awarded Twice
awards.description: The award is given for meritorious service or achievement in a combat or non-combat situation based on sustained performance or specific achievement of a superlative nature, and shall be of such merit as to warrant more tangible recognition than is possible by a fitness report or performance evaluation, but which does not warrant a Navy and Marine Corps Commendation Medal or higher.

awards.title: Naval Air Medal
awards.description: The United States Navy issues air medals to crew who display heroism or meritorious service in the face of an enemy while in flight. To earn an air medal, pilots and other crew must meet certain requirements laid out by the Navy in a document called "Secretary of the Navy Instruction (SECNAVINST) 1650.1H."

publications.name: New Thinking for European Defence Innovation
New Thinking for European Defence Innovation
publications.publisher: Association of Finnish Defence and Aerospace Industries

company.name: NATO - Defence Innovation Accelerator for the North Atlantic (DIANA)

profile_positions.company: NATO - Defence Innovation Accelerator for the North Atlantic (DIANA)
profile_positions.description:
I’m happy to be serving as a Challenge Manager and the Lead for the DIANA Fellows program at NATO's newest body, the Defense Innovation Accelerator for the North Atlantic (DIANA).

DIANA is a dynamic new NATO body that aims to bring Emerging and Disruptive Technologies (EDTs) to life for both the NATO Enterprise and NATO Nations. I'm looking forward to building bridges from my past work with the Dutch MOD, NATO NCI Agency, and within industry to achieve a step-change in technical capabilities in support of our sailors, airmen, and soldiers. #innovation #NATO
profile_positions.title: Chief Information Officer (Interim)  / Challenge Manager, NATO DIANA

profile_positions.description:
Adapting ESA’s Concurrent Design Facility into a more generalized concept called a “DecisionHall” that provides tools, processes, and advanced facilities that enable multi-disciplinary teams to make robust decisions and achieve much greater levels of stakeholder alignment than is possible using traditional decision-making approaches. 

Currently executing a multi-faceted business development plan that targets the maritime sector, and companies undertaking complex energy transition, sustainability / circular economy, and climate resilience projects. Developing promotional materials, foundation business documents, product / services catalogue, and more (examples available upon request).

Developed solution architecture for advanced cloud-based decision tools that give organisations the ability to gain insights into their decision processes and ultimately apply ML/AI to improve decision making. Currently leading the effort to implement the data model in Microsoft SQL Azure and develop web, mobile, and desktop software to empower end-users to make robust, defendable, and more deterministic decisions.  

In Q4 2022, completed the PortXL Innovation Accelerator Program of the Port of Rotterdam, where we engaged with a wide range of government and private sector stakeholders in the Rotterdam area. Currently a member of the WorldStartup Altitude program.
profile_positions.title: Co-Founder / Managing Director

profile_positions.description:
A companion company to DecisionHall (see above), The Climate Action Center aims to create system-of-system level digital models of complex climate projects and make these models free and open-source using a business model similar to Red Hat Software.

Developed business concept and am exploring raising funding through grants and impact investors to launch the business as an independent impact, steward-owned company.
profile_positions.title: Co-Founder / Managing Director

profile_positions.description:
InnoVet Europe is a defence-focused consultancy based in Europe that specializes in multinational defence innovation and representing the needs of small and medium enterprises within the defence community.

Currently serving as the co-chairman of the NATO Industrial Advisory Group (NIAG) Innovation Community of Interest to provide industry advice to NATO on the topic of defence innovation. Led an effort by a US company (InnoVet USA) in 2021 to introduce Digital Engineering and Concurrent Design to the US Air Force (USAF) through the USAF Small Business Innovative Research Program (SBIR). Served as Principal Investigator on a USAF Phase II SBIR submission that resulted in a $1.3m contract with the USAF Nuclear Weapons Center to pilot the use of Concurrent Design within the US Ground Based Strategic Deterrent Program (GBSD). Continue to act as a strategic advisor to the US company as it pursues additional contracts with the US Department of Defense.
Providing leadership support as DisTec Chairman and Keynote Speaker addressing disruptive technology topics at European defence conferences including two IT2EC conferences (2019, 2022), DSEI 2021 in London, and Underwater Defence Technology 2022 in Rotterdam. Continuing to advise Clarion regarding emerging and disruptive military technologies (EDTs), how they relate to real-world defence operations, and how to present EDTs at conferences.
profile_positions.title: Founder / Consultant

profile_positions.description: The Defence Innovation Greenhouse is a non-profit innovation, collaboration and best practices center serving public sector crisis responders.  It is clear that we're stronger when we work together, which is why we are building a world class facility where multinational teams can collaborate to use the latest technologies to solve pressing problems for our crisis responders.
profile_positions.title: Executive Director

profile_positions.company: NATO Communications and Information Agency (NCI Agency)
profile_positions.description:
Project Manager, NCIA Support Services Contract (Nov 2014-Jan 2016)
Led the effort for five tenders to industry for staff augmentation contracts worth over €90 million. Assisted in drafting of Invitation for Bid documentation; responsible for identifying and documenting Agency staffing requirements across all five major business domain areas. Led 23 bid evaluators to perform evaluations on 31 bids received. All 5 contracts were awarded with over 150 interim staff being placed through these contract vehicles in 2016.

Served as Program Manager for the €11 million NCI Agency Enterprise Business Applications Program (including an ERP implementation).  Leading a diverse team from across the NCI Agency in an effort to “Retool the Organization to operate in the 21st century” by replacing the Agency’s aging Finance, HR, Acquisition, Project Management and CIS Asset Management systems.

Nominated to join the NCI Agency’s 8-member Core Transition Team which was charged with overseeing the merger of five NATO bodies into a single coherent organization with 3000+ staff. Main responsibilities were the coordination of 8 key transition projects with a heavy emphasis on information management across the NCI Agency and NATO as a whole. Assigned as Programme Manager responsible for change management projects in the Agency's HR, Finance and Acquisition departments.
profile_positions.title: Principal Scientist

profile_positions.description:
Served as Liaison Officer between NC3A and the Agency's largest customer, the NATO military command structure headquartered at SHAPE in Mons, Belgium. Managed portfolio of 70+ projects and acted as a key interface between Project Managers and the Agency's military customers. Provided managerial support to the establishment of the NATO Comprehensive Crisis and Operations Management Centre. 

Technical Lead and Solution Architect for NATO's Integration Core project. Led the effort to obtain funding for a €7 million project to implement a flexible integration middleware solution for connecting IT systems from various NATO nations operating in Afghanistan. Developed initial high-level designs and worked closely with contractors to mature those designs into a final product.

Project Manager for Initiation phase of the NATO Afghanistan Mission Network project. Led a team of over 30 people in the drafting a major funding request for a €25 million, multi-year effort to implement the NATO Afghanistan Mission Network. 

Volunteered to serve as Agency Liaison Officer in Afghanistan in support of the International Security Assistance Force (ISAF) for four months in 2007-2008. While assigned in Afghanistan, acted as the senior Agency staff member in ISAF and represented the Agency on a wide-range of initiatives. 

While assigned in Afghanistan, provided database analysis and upgrades on ISAF friendly force tracking system, logistics systems, and theatre-wide incident and event tracking system. Identified significant flaws in deployed databases and provided on-the spot repairs needed to restore full functionality to mission critical operational systems.

To this day, continue to maintain full deployment readiness (medical, training, etc.) and have volunteered to deploy at any time on short notice upon request. Received the NATO medal for length of service in a combat operation and commendation from high-ranking military officials upon my departure.
profile_positions.title: Principal Scientist

profile_positions.description: Assigned to NC3A Intelligence Section. Led projects to integrate NATO intelligence systems with Command and Control (C2), operational planning, logistics, and national systems. Specific duties include: creating a vision and architecture for integrating Intel systems with external systems, acting as liaison with the customer (Allied Command Operations), leading the development effort, and delivery of functional prototypes.
profile_positions.title: Senior Scientist

profile_positions.description:
Founded a non-profit organization to provide market-relevant IT training to recently unemployed technology workers following the Dot-Com bust. Recruited an all-volunteer team that conducted three training conferences in 2003-2004. Provided recently unemployed technology workers who were laid off from companies such as Cisco, Nortel and IBM with 30 hours of intensive technical training and career development assistance. Helped over 600 local tech workers gain new market-relevant skills so they could re-enter the IT workforce.

Established key partnerships with national-level IT organizations including Developmentor, SAS, Red Hat to provide free training; media outlets including the Raleigh News and Observer and Capitol Broadcasting to provide free publicity and North Carolina State University to provide free facilities and career counseling.

Taught 5 day Microsoft SQL Server class to 35 students during 3rd training event.
profile_positions.title: Founder, Vice-Chairman of the Board of Directors (volunteer position)

profile_positions.description:
Duties included architecture, design, implementation and testing of user interface technologies for SAS's flagship Enterprise Guide business intelligence product. 

Acted as team leader for a group of 25 staff members in an ad-hoc initiative to improve operational procedures and business processes in the R&D department. Team members included senior managers, developers, analysts, and testers. 

Chosen by the CTO in 2003 to serve on a seven-member task force to create an Enterprise Architecture Team to provide technical governance to 1000+ R&D staff members across the globe.
profile_positions.title: Senior Software Developer

profile_positions.description: Founded multimedia start-up firm. Designed and implemented a multi-tiered web-based application for automating the process of converting digital photographs into broadcast-quality (MPEG-2) video presentations. Market conditions associated with Dot-com crash in the third quarter of 2001 prevented us from raising working capital causing us to indefinitely suspend operation of the company.
profile_positions.title: Co-Founder, CTO, System Architect & Senior Developer

volunteer_experiences.description: TechEngage was a startup training organization that I founded in 2003 to help technology workers who had recently lost their jobs due to the "Dot-Com Bust". Many of these workers had old technology skills in equipment and systems that had been (or were being) phased out due to Y2K issues. The purpose of TechEngage was to take these workers and provide them with market relevant skills in database design, web application development, Java and .NET programming and other skills.  We hosted 3 conferences and provided technical training and career guidance to over 600 unemployed workers in the Raleigh, Durham, Chapel Hill area.  Overall it was a very successful venture. When the economy began to improve, we closed the organization because employment had recovered.
